sentences.sContent: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.sCn: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.sContent: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.sCn: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.sContent: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.sCn: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

sentences.sContent: ...and also Americans to the art and culture of France and Italy for the next 300 years...
...the Royal Society in London said in its report that scientists need to “shift away from a research culture where data is viewed as a private preserve”...
...dongting lake enjoys a good reputation in Chinese culture as the place of origin of dragon boat racing...
...the company culture must switch from these point-in-time innovations to a continuous pipeline of innovations from everywhere and everyone...
...a business or a country should strive to build a corporate culture or a social climate that values innovation...
...the "Mona Lisa" came to represent Western culture itself...
...we still use culture as a badge of identity...
...There wasn't really a college-bound culture at my high school...
...people have cultures and not all cultures are compatible with the culture in this country that has produced such benefits for the American people for so long...
...Despite negative stereotypes about sports culture and Ripley's presumption that academics and athletics are at odds with one another...

synos.tran: 文化，文明；修养；[农学]栽培

phrases.pCn: 大众文化，通俗文化；流行文化
培养基（培养微生物的养料）
流行文化；通俗文化；波普文化

remMethod.val: cult(培养) ＋ ure(表状态) → 教养； 文化

words.tran: 有教养的；人工培养的；讲究的
从文化角度，文化意义上；在人文学方面

trans.tranCn: 文化， 文明； 教养； 培养； 培养菌
trans.tranOther: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society
